properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow and blowing snow in store for today. A Pacific low pressure system will cross the Haines-Skagway Roads today bringing heavy snow. Total snowfall amounts of 20 cm or more are likely through this evening. In addition, strong south winds will develop this morning and then shift to strong north winds this evening. This will cause widespread blowing snow and poor visibilities. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-11T00:07:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-10T08:08:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0747801067.2020
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp, South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Smog Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High concentration of pollutants are expected and will result in poor air quality, especially in urban areas where pollutant emissions are higher. The high concentrations of pollutants should persist until this afternoon. ### Smog especially affects asthmatic children and people with respiratory ailments or heart disease. It is therefore recommended that these individuals avoid intense physical activity outdoors until the smog warning is lifted. In Quebec, wood heating is the main source of fine particles that contribute to smog during winter. This activity generates the largest number of these particulates, more than industrial activities and transportation. Additional information: To learn more about the Info-Smog program, go to Environment Canada’s website at www.canada.ca/info-smog-program. For air quality indexes in Quebec, visit the website of the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques at www.iqa.environnement.gouv.qc.ca/contenu/index_en.asp. For the air quality index in Montréal, visit the Réseau de surveillance de la qualité de l’air de la Ville de Montréal’s website at www.rsqa.qc.ca (french only). To learn more about the effects of smog on your health in Québec, visit the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux’s website at www.quebec.ca/en/health. You can also visit the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal at www.santemontreal.qc.ca/en/public. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-02-11T03:06:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal, 2020-02-10T10:07:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4113165402.2020
Area: Portneuf area, Valcartier - Stoneham area, Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area, Saint-Lambert area, Lotbinière area, Lac-Etchemin area, Sainte-Marie-de-Beauce area, Saint-Georges-de-Beauce area, Montmagny - Saint-Jean-Port-Joli area, Saint-Fabien - Saint-Pamphile area
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, the Ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux, the Direction régionale de santé publique du CIUSSS du Centre-Sud-de-l’Île-de-Montréal, the City of Montréal

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. Snow and blowing snow in store today. A Pacific low pressure system will develop in the Gulf of Alaska and then cross the Alaska Panhandle today. It will track east along the 60th parallel to pass just south of Whitehorse late this afternoon and close to Watson Lake by late this evening. Snow is forecast to develop before morning and persist all day. Total snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm are likely through Monday night. In addition, south winds will develop this morning and then shift to strong northwest winds this evening. This will cause local blowing snow and poor visibilities. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-11T00:18:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-10T08:19:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3079798174.2020
Area: Watson Lake, Cassiar Mountains, Teslin, Kluane Lake, Haines Junction, Whitehorse
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of very cold wind chills is expected. A bitterly cold airmass with temperatures near -40 and winds of 20 to 40 km/h will result in extreme wind chills in the -55 to -60 range over the next couple of days. These extreme cold conditions are currently affecting Hall Beach and the northern Kivalliq but will spread into southern Kivalliq communities tonight. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-11T01:27:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-10T09:28:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2966642655.2020
Area: Baker Lake, Arviat, Rankin Region including Whale Cove, Chesterfield Inlet, Naujaat, Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow coming to an end late this morning. Moderate snow will continue for a few more hours before tapering off late this morning. Up to 5 additional centimetres will be possible bringing storm total accumulations up to 8 to 12 cm. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-10T22:00:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-10T09:44:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0544724549.2020
Area: Gatineau, Merrickville-Wolford - Kemptville, Brockville - Prescott, Maxville - Alexandria, Cornwall - Lancaster, Winchester - Newington, Morrisburg - Long Sault, Prescott and Russell, Ottawa North - Kanata - Orléans, Ottawa South - Richmond - Metcalfe
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of very cold wind chills is expected. A bitterly cold airmass moving southward out of the high arctic will bring temperatures of -35 to -40 to parts of the eastern Arctic. These temperatures will combine with light to moderate winds to produce dangerous wind chills near -55 at times throughout the remainder of the weekend. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-10T12:40:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-09T20:41:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2838931994.2020
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of very cold wind chills continues. The coldest wind chill values will be between minus 55 and minus 60. Extreme cold wind chill values will persist today. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-11T01:22:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-10T09:23:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2585576009.2020
Area: Taloyoak, Gjoa Haven, Kugaaruk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Total snowfall: 15 to 20 cm. Locations: Channel-Port aux Basques and Burgeo - Ramea. Time span: near noon today until early Tuesday morning. Remarks: Increasing winds this afternoon could result in reduced visibilities in blowing snow, especially over exposed areas. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-02-11T00:45:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-10T08:46:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2963686595.2020
Area: Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
